help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd1:
Before you can use this feature, sign up for DDNS service with a DDNS service provider,
www.dyndns.org or www.noip.com.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd2: Note: After you have made your changes, click Save Settings to apply your changes.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd8: Enter the username for your DynDNS or No-IP account.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd10: Enter the password for your DynDNS or No-IP account.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd12: Enter the host name for your DynDNS or No-IP account.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd14: Select the DynDNS or No-IP service you use. The default is Dynamic.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd16: Enter the address of your mail exchange server, so emails to your DynDNS or no-ip address go to your mail server.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd18: This option allows the Mail eXchange (MX) server to be a backup.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd20: This option enables or disables the use of wildcards for your DDNS address host.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd22: The Router's Internet IP address is displayed. Because it is dynamic, it will change periodically.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd26: To manually trigger an update, click Update.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd29: Enter the username for TZO account.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd31: Enter the password for your TZO account.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd33: Enter the domain name for your TZO account.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd35: The Router's Internet IP address is displayed. Because it is dynamic, it will change periodically.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd39: To manually trigger an update, click Update.
help_security_ddns.lang_hsdd40: Note: For more information, refer to the online User Guide at www.linksys.com.
